result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle L Bowman

records.addlTxt:
11:07 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michelle L Bowman in court.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Michelle L Bowman. 
Defense recites the DAGP agreement. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1 as charged in the Information. Court finds defendant entered the plea voluntarily and knowingly and accepts the plea but withholds a finding of Guilt. 
An 18 month DAGP is filed with and accepted by the Court.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 21, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on December 21, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Plea hearing on June 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:15 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michelle L Bowman in court.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Michelle L Bowman. 
Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas-Received by the Court. Defendant has a meeting with Mr Judd on June 9th. 
A plea hearing is scheduled for June 21st at 11:00 AM (in person).

Reserve Judge William Gabler for Branch 1 Intake. 
Case called at 9:41 AM.
Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Michelle L Bowman in court with Attorney Alicia Linzmeier.  Defendant waives her right to Preliminary Hearing.. 
Branch 5 to schedule ARGN.

12:45 PM case called. Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Michelle L Bowman appeared in court without counsel. 
Waives reading of the complaint and time limits for the preliminary hearing. Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 3-9-22 at 1:45 PM. 
Return to court: 3-31-22 at 9:30 AM.
